pff56fKAxEIdGaEX7cvaSA.text: Amazing place! Great staff and affordable prices. Location is perfect... Came here for breakfast, will be going back again.

pVBzZjeEiN5kGEPyOYaygw.text: I spent 7 weeks in London about 5 years ago and lived nearby on Lexham Gardens. This was my absolute favorite neighborhood spot and I went there at least 1-2 times per week. When I booked my flight a few months ago to visit London again for vacation last week, all I could think of was getting my hands on their roasted vegetable and goat cheese sandwich. I didn't remember the name of the cafe but I knew it was by the Gloucester tube stop and I just prayed that A) it was still open and B) that they still made those sandwiches. They did.Dear god do I love that sandwich, right off the hot press, with slightly warmed/gooey goat cheese and roasted vegetables...mmm. Prices are pretty darn good (couldn't find a cheaper double espresso even up in Belsize Park) and the rest of my party all really enjoyed their pizzas (personal size with 4 toppings for only 5 pounds) and sandwiches. It's a cute spot with great prices and food. I highly recommend it and wish there was one in NYC!

xwHLszVu5D-hqtbOUQh9xw.text: Good food and coffee, Very nice stuff and atmosphere, free croissants in the mornings, great background music and free wifi that actually works easily!

T47ljAhMMNgB7S0YEGz_-g.text: This was the only place we ever really found in Kensington that was open in the late late hours of the night where you could grab something to eat that wasn't from Tesco... It's a pretty typical deli, they have sandwichy things, I'm a big quiche fan,  pasta things, etc.   I think if it was only open in the day I'd be lukewarm on it, but the fact that you can go there... I think until 2 or 3am gives them some extra stars.. It's also a stop for the tube workers that are doing overnight shifts so I'm guessing that's how they keep their business in the wee hours, but there's still the die-hards that stumble down Gloucester road in search of late night munchies.

UWDqM_vq2b36EISmY820Bw.text: Caffe Forum is the best beginning of the day. Til 11 am if you buy a coffee drink you get a free croissant (which is fantastic!) They're priced very well for the area. They're sandwiches are good, but made on white bread (not my favorite). All in all, a great cafe experience!

Tu1DmmecxvoIJzoE2NPZSQ.text: Caffe Forum was a great discovery during our two week London vacation. Right around the corner from the hotel, it was a take away godsend after a long day of seeing London's many sights.  We particularly liked their quiche, both the vegetable and the ham and cheese varieties were delicious. The Pizza Panini was tasty, as was the Spanakopita, a Greek dish with spinach and melted cheese inside folded over Filo bread.  We wished we had been able to try more of their desserts, as the apple strudel was quite good. I noticed they even serve milkshakes there.Everything we had was fresh, high-quality and reasonably priced, topped off with friendly service.  And hot - a bonus for microwave-challenged hotel visitors. Good place!

43T9XuDe7XTpMcIBUsWDEg.text: Very popular place for tourists in a non touristic area. I guess, there is some recommendation in a London guide for this place.Kind of alternative italian restaurant, with:- good coffee drinks and breakfast items- espresso is OK (could be better for my taste)- sandwiches - noodle, lasagne and salats- danish pastry Very relaxed and slow service ;-)Good place to spend some time to relax - there is no pressure to move!

xDIRZd6mVzD_SvPEEuiNXA.text: Reasonably priced food, passable coffee. I find their pack of crema on my long black disturbing. Pay at the counter, seat yourself. Ordered a long black and a spinach pie. Free croissant with coffee is a nice touch, but tastes strangely of chlorine. Spinach pie was pre prepped and reheated in a microwave. Soggy filling, soft pastry. Ok for a quick meal or coffee but not much else.

D_hEDP38kzs3FBS3h6jK1g.text: My novels and short stories came to life here. Caffe Forum, situated just down the block from Gloucester Road Tube station, is where I came nearly everyday for three years to sit down and work on my writing. It is quaint, cute, and always smells of exquisite coffee. Their cappuccinos were the best I've had in London. It is the perfect cafe if there could be such a thing.

T20HTlyDrRaW6ljLiIJbeg.text: This a great place to grab a quick bite if you're in the Gloucester Road Tube Station area. They're generous with their portions. I had the Asian noodles and chicken salad combo for only £6,45. They're open late, serve coffee, wine, beer and pizza. It's a great no-fuss escape from the craziness on Gloucester road.

YUATFxQpbpFvabBg0bi-iA.text: nice atmosphere, chess and backgammon available, cappucino was excellent.

CHyBdlyA5ecKB9mosJ6xfA.text: Worst service ever. I waited over 30 minutes for 2 sausage wrapped croissants, and I had to ask for them twice. The second time I asked they merely had to warm them up for 3 minutes and bring them to me. Simply awful. Unless you plan on reading the morning paper from beginning to end, move on to a more responsive establishment.

p-EURGYIO8Tx5Xj7mqAO_Q.text: Great coffee, very reasonable price and very friendly service. Can't comment on the good as I have only had coffee there so far.Btw don't forget you might be able to score a free croissant with your coffee in the morning!!

vbzsfaw9PhTLR8Y3x9mJvA.text: My friend and I dropped in for some breakfast on a Saturday morning.  The food and coffee were very reasonably priced (the free croissant with your hot drink is a nice bonus) and delicious.  The service however was not great.  They messed up my friend's order and forgot mine completely.  The staff were very friendly and helpful when we alerted them to their mistake but it did dampen our enjoyment a little.

Wexzrzp32BKY0lE3o6WkpA.text: There will always be a special place in my heart for Caffe Forum.There aren't too many places like it that serve good, quick food, in a nice environment, that's fresh!Caffe Forum is great for two things:1) Weekend breakfasts2) Casual afternoon lunchesThey have some great breakfast (eggs, bacon, toast and tea); very enjoyable to eat in a relaxing environment, curled up with the morning paper. The individuals who work there are all right if you take more time than is required to eat - and are OK if you 'chill out' a bit. It's nice to sit around and people watch, either from the indoor or outside tables.Caffe Forum is also great for a casual lunch - you can either take one of their many pre-made sandwiches on the go with you, or you can enjoy there. In addition to the premade sandwiches, they also have a rotating selection of hot dishes.Definitely a local favourite!

ZDbzuS1uJ8qRtRoIqNWuOg.text: Has a somewhat touristy feel to it, must be in some guide books because they are drawn to it like the proverbial flies on...  Despite this it has plenty of character which is not lost by a transient crowd. The staff are friendly and the prices are decent for the area. The coffee is very good, nice and strong. Mornings you can order a coffee and get a free croissant! I honestly don't know why anyone would go to the chain coffee houses on the street.

anOTrSi97WbCO8QfjNW42w.text: I ate here every morning I was in London and love it. The coffee is great, and they include a free croissant. The pastries are good, and priced right. The English bfast includes beans, sausage, and bacon - plenty of energy for a long walk around London. The ham and cheese was a hit for the kids and at 2.50 was just right. Very close to Gloucester Rd station and the Crown Plaza

2_UTGENQKOmFIt2bYbXzGg.text: Quickie Yelp. Great for full English Breakfast replete with egg, sausage, ham, mushrooms, tomatoes, beans and toast. All that for £9. Woot. Man had a ham and cheese croissant in order to help me finish off my big ol plate. His was also very good and inexpensive 0 under £4. Cappuccinos were delish and served in huge cups. Best to order the full breakfast if filling up prior to lots of tube travel and touristy stuff. I definitely did not want lunch and was sated until dinner time. If we'd had an opportunity, I would have liked to have gone back to try out the pizzas everyone raved about.Awesome value, actually crazy awesome value and right next to the Gloucester tube stop. Order inside at the counter and they deliver the food. We sat outside at one of the cafe tables which afforded me the opportunity to fashion watch. It's all about black tights and bold prints. Word.

XGmRiYTbaXoiMCSDLqLuCQ.text: Brilliant little place with friendly staff. Had the very hearty and delicious Full English and also gorged ourselves on the croissants!

UjAX4f16U0HwEvdzpqjn8A.text: Great little shop. Free croissant from 7-11:45 each morning with purchase of a coffee. The coffee was fantastic, if not quite what I expected as an American asking for one. It's what we call a cafe americano, basically a double shot espresso with steamed water.

2MOSbPcIIwyig_rBaUIFWA.text: This is my go-to place for every meal. I especially love getting dinner here. Everything is so affordable and homemade and delicious.  I have had almost everything in the glass case; the aubergine parmigiana, bbq chicken quarters , salmon, etc... and I can honestly say that everything has been delicious.  They also switch up their main dishes so you can find something new every time you go. You get the main dinner plus a side salad , rice and a piece of baguette for about 6 or 7 pounds, which is just unbeatable.  The cappuccino's are also delicious and like the other reviews said if you get a coffee before 11am they give you a free croissant! The ham and cheese panini is also my go to for lunch.  The only thing I would say is not to get the fresh squeezed orange juice, it always tastes weird in my opinion. Other than that this place is the best!!

kLFJFJ8Is8EjKJ0RGerL9A.text: A good place for breakfast no doubt about it. Nice selection, good service and a cozy atmosphere.

p-6Sx3sZUQ0BP7mBj-Ikyg.text: I love the paninis!!!! Soo delicious and you get a free croissant with your coffee! Perfect!

YKkHDhvhmwIu8duShm6scw.text: Great price for the food, but the staff needs to pay attention to some orders where they forgot mine. Could be jus a one off... Cheers

70W0hg3AUU-dWbF2g6dI-Q.text: Nice little cafe in the heart of Kensington, has a bit of a French feel too it. It's normally quiet busy especially in the morning around 8-9am. The staff are helpful and always polite. I tend to use this place for breakfast. The sausage baguette or full English are my usuals. Prices are slightly more than a greasy spoon cafe but nothing to crazy. First 100 customs per day get a free croissant with a hot drink.

JxkF2yRrHLO7v8x9SScG5w.text: Free croissants are bomb, best croissant I've ever had, and so are the friendly staff. Coffee is definitely just milk and espresso like everywhere else so I can't bitch about it.

5I2SJTD5KzhbypAj6KQUBw.text: My husband and I expent few days in London and skipped the hotel restaurant to experience something local. This place was a great choice. As tourists we were expecting to have our order taken at the table but a young waiter kindly explained to us that we should order at the cashier. We tried the traditional English breakfast that happened to be very plenty, we should order one and maybe a cup of fruit and share. The place has a lot of character, a lot of locals and the coffee was excellent. My husband tried the white coffee which was a delight. Definitely a good option if you are on the area.

xDdV8-1SL176dfwVN4Acnw.text: Awesome place to enjoy an authentic English breakfast and other great eats. Prices can't be beat! First 100 customers to order a coffee get a free croissant. We went about 0900-0930 both mornings and still all got the croissant.

K2BnYp9lCCC2Fd9QhXUVqA.text: I always try to find local eateries when on holiday. Every now and then you find a gem like this. Food is good with generous portions. Atmosphere with a bit of gouche​ modern flair. Good eats and inexpensive. The coffee (and other caffinated drinks) are excellent. Service is a little lacking but I chalk that  up to the crowd and chaos. Seating is tight so come early.

3Tab6lkqjJWY0WQl7INPKA.text: We started our day here each day while in London.  On the first day we stopped in it was full of metropolitan police getting coffee so we knew right then it was good!  Free croissant with any kind of coffee and a great price for full English breakfast.  Great atmosphere too!  Highly recommended!

_zrtI6bLG09RTg8rQzj13A.text: Found this place on yelp during a short stay in London and decided to give it a try. The coffee was delicious and so was the complimentary butter croissant. I got the vegetarian breakfast and the portion was very generous and everything was really tasty. It's totally worth it!Oh! And you do seat yourself and order at the register, but everyone is absolutely charming. Will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian breakfast. Substituted the beans for extra tomato.
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Menu!

AThTrUPUqskZYak7mhHFww.text: A lovely establishment for breakfast / lunch / dinner or whenever you feel like eating. Or coffee. Or tea. We were 4 nights in a hotel at cromwell rd, cafe forum is just down the street from gloucester rd tube station. We had breakfast here 3 times, and 3 times dinner as well. Breakfast: If you don't like mushrooms for breakfast (full english includes these) you can switch it for something you do like. If you start the day with a hot drink, you get a free croissant.Loved the spinach pie, the pizza is good, as is the lasagne. We had too little time to sample all they offer, because we kept ordering food we had before. It was so good!About the staff: they were simply brilliant. Had a lovely time, got lots of useful info and they had or made time for a chat. All in all, if you're in the neighbourhood: go here!

t7rTgtvbb3-5xsRmo_PsrQ.text: We were in London for 6 days and had breakfast here daily. The drinks were fresh and hot. The croissants were better than some we had in France. The fruit, fresh and delicious the eggs and sausage great too. This place a a huge value and so convenient.

wLRLNgdtW5BJj8tJL25B2w.text: The location is extremely convenient as it is right out of Gloucester Road station. I'm currently travelling, so my friend and I exit the underground feeling as hungry as ever! It's nice to have a trustworthy place to chow down before we head home.The food is decent, but I keep coming back for the friendly service! The staff really try their best to make your order as enjoyable as possible, and they try to be as flexible as they can.I would definitely recommend this place! The staff recognizes us now :)

Yvd5wQN88t1YnGNJ_7YvnA.text: Great, cozy little spot. Eat there or takeaway. I recommend their quiche and their toasties. Friendly staff, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Ham and cheese toastie from the Baby Jesus.
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate cannoli. Boom.

RoJ7CPxRaauGODHfvF0nKg.text: This is a nice small cafe with great coffee and  a small neighborhood feel which can be hard to find in London with all the bad touristy places.  Solid english breakfast, good croissants and lovely service.  Nice decor as well.  If I am in South Kensington, this is my "go to" for a nice start to the day.  Sit inside or out.  Oh, and I forgot, fair pricing! For once I dont feel ripped off.

ALPADr7DoW4W9zoORVjBSQ.text: Our place of choice great coffee and with free croissant that's complimentary it's amazing. Open early to late hours. Today we're going to have the full English breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Great coopuccino
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Coffee is excellent

K7RJAsx_HNIQBE_byyuNoQ.text: This was a fantastic find during my daily school commute. The service here is lovely and there isn't enough to say about the ambiance; it's plain fantastic. They give you a free complimentary croissant during the week if you order a hot drink before 11:45 a.m., but if that isn't a possibility, they have a good selection of cold and hot foods for a cafe. I love it here and I cannot recommend it enough.

4YwRC20TZnTMG4sYcGId4w.text: Great place short walk from my hotel. Amazingly friendly staff very helpful. It was my first time there and they explained what they had. Offered me free wifi and brought out my order to me on the patio. Definately come here again next time I'm in london. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Had spinach and cheese pit for breakfast. Delish. The potatoes were perfectly cooked as well. I like the new store arrangement too.
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Tuna sandwich with corn in it. Delicious. And a cafe late. On the patio. Christmas eve.
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Great ambiance. Smells when I walked in reminds me of home.

Vksz3QxU6k5THIk1sGKvKA.text: Saw a review on Yelp & decided to take a chance. Seat yourself dining, ordered two full English breakfasts and a tea (free croissant with a hot drink). English breakfast consisted of one egg, two sausages, two strips of bacon, ice cold baked beans, tomato, mushrooms and toast. Nothing was hot except my tea. The tea was delicious. I know a full English breakfast is supposed to be hot. As someone from London, I was sorely disappointed especially since I had someone with me from the States.Will not be dining at the Caffe Forum again.  area of London. At least I know what to avoid. The two stars are for the tea alone!

kvp7ZYyvGe_TVYl3zWJxwQ.text: I came here with a group of friends one night after watching Billy Elliot. We were hungry and thirsty and this place was right next to the tube. It was pretty empty when we arrived.  We ordered some pizzas to share and two pitchers of Pimms. I am glad we decided to give this place a try. The sausage pizza was great, this coming from someone who's lived in NYC ! And the Pimms was refreshing.  All the girls were fighting over the strawberries. That service was also pretty spectacular. This is overall a solid place for a late night bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Yummy and refreshing !!!

LiFq6QDGsSJ9pur-Uq-CZA.text: Caffe Forum is decent place to grab a breakfast (ranging from panini to a classic full english breakfast) before you head out for sight seeing in London. It's close to both the Gloucester tube station and several hotels like the Holiday Inn. This place can be quite busy during the morning rush but people tend to mow down and clear out. You won't find people indulging in a long leisurely breakfast. Most of the crowd seems like tourists and it seems a great place to run into Germans, French, and even the odd Canadian.I quite enjoyed their bacon, cheese, and tomato panini. The bacon tasted a little odd to my Canadian tastes (where we tend to cur our breakfast meats in equal measures of maple syrup and salt). But after my third panini (not in the same sitting) I found the different taste growing on me.Every coffee order comes with a croissant, which seems another bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Two fried eggs on toast

mUgv0hwrBEXfSNY-Xc1XNw.text: What more can I say? Friendly staff, great coffee, breakfasts made to order, and a check that had me thinking they'd got it wrong. There's no "decor" to speak of, but the vibe and atmosphere are brilliant. Our new favorite morning stop before exploring London.

_-rVuZldPBgqQ90JwnJGOw.text: This place had good food, they just give you food at the counter, and the prices are alright. This place is optimal for a quick bite. It is also very close to a hotel and metro station.The coffee does come with a free croissant. The beans here are sweet and pair very well with the bread.

iqANnSXYE_KiO9H77sIolw.text: We enjoyed breakfast here every morning for a week while we were staying in South Kensington. The coffee was good with a bonus free croissant. I had the fruit salad which was delicious and slightly different each morning while my husband tried all the hot dishes! We loved it! Very relaxed and also good spot to set up to do some work or send emails.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

KB2CujZfLrOkMKzB5fmY8w.text: This was the best English breakfast I've ever had, which probably isn't saying much cause the bar is pretty low hahaha! Regardless! Great price! A ton of food! And all of it was pretty damn good! Great bacon, good cook on the eggs. Overall great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

vAkZFopg9JKocopquAAC2A.text: We only came here for the coffee, but their mochas are delicious! For less than £3, you can get a large, tasty, chocolate piece of heaven that will keep you satisfied until lunch. They also have regular coffee, lattes, smoothies, and tea. The cafe itself is very charming, but some spots just seemed like they needed to be cleaned. The place offers very random items and doesn't seem to specialize in a specific type of food. They offer a full English breakfast, pastries, pizza, Chinese food, Indian food, meat shanks, etc...so I'm not sure how any of that is!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Tasty mocha!

g4FVPAjvW9cp1bgiwWf1vw.text: The most horrible and disgusting food I've ever had in London.  I ordered the shepherd's pie, which was already pre-cooked, they simply microwaved it to heat it, and was still cold in the middle.  It came plopped on top of a disgusting garden salad, and a dry piece of bread.  The place was filthy and the server/owner piled our plates on top of each other with the food on them when she brought it to our table!  The only reason we went to this place is because it has good reviews, which really boggles my mind because everything about it is DISGUSTING!

h6WTa9ee2Teen8OHOXW6QA.text: A wonderful casual breakfast spot that was recommended to us by a server from the restaurant where we had dinner the night before.Perfect for a quick, delicious meal to start your day on a right foot.We ordered one Full English breakfast & one Vegetarian English breakfast.You get a free croissant & freshly squeezed orange juice with each order. (This is what a real croissant should taste like!!)Coffee was nice & strong. Service friendly & attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian English Breakfast
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Free croissant with coffee and free freshly squeezed  OJ with meal

GevNg2zQ3eufqPsCqQMmeQ.text: Honestly was disappointed. The staff weren't very nice and the setup is odd. Before I left London I wanted an English breakfast. It didn't come with black pudding is what I wanted to try. The rest of the plate tasted like it was warmed up for serve and honestly had zero flavor. I will say that the coffee was outstanding.

xCZPovv4y8xX6WX_wtHX3g.text: I'm confused my all the good reviews. I went there with a friend after reading reviews, and we were both disappointed. We both ordered dishes containing poached eggs, and all the eggs were fully cooked through. They also over cooked my bacon. They forgot about my friends coffee and she had to remind them, and when it came it was extremely weak. The one positive was that they put a lot of avocado on my pieces of toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. avocado toast w/ over cooked eggs

Ug_5q4ThoRPHcDs6Eo-jUg.text: Very good pizza!  Visiting from the US, our son really wanted a pizza so just stopped in and ordered a Margarita pizza to go. It was a small wait but the pizza came out hot and delicious.  We didn't grab any but the cannolis looked great.  Very kid friendly as well.

JFXyoK0SafMCg7jEBN2s5Q.text: Don't know who's perpetuating lies on this but the croissants are 95 pence not free.... pretty good breakfast though

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

GP2rC7HoYQvw-mnwTRPANQ.text: This review is a long time coming.We stopped here on our final morning of our trip to London - Pretty much on our way to the subway to get to the Eurostar on our way to Gay Paris. I couldn't leave England without having a "Big English Breakfast". It was the typical Cafe setting and was a perfect end to a wonderful trip.A good last memory of England. Thank you Caffe Forum.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

PKR__ynuB2163i2Uuyv4uw.text: The coffee was good, but the food was so-so. The location is excellent, as it is close to the tube, and near many hotels. It's a good spot to stop by if you need a quick cup before running into the tube.

CF5tRF4CKbEKua0WlUThbw.text: We had the English breakfast minus the beans.I think we were poisoned. Literally 30 minutes after we ate here We became sick. Maybe it was the lack of attention by the personnel. Maybe it was the lack of attention in the kitchen with the angry bearded gentleman that brought the food. Whatever it was I think I've received food poisoning. my wife and I haven't stopped going to the toiletall day. Save your money, your time ,your health and go somewhere else.

lNdcy2Y8uizhj2az3kWkXw.text: I give this place 3 stars just because the food was very good. Customer service was not, got our order wrong from the start. Took nearly 15 mins to get our drinks & coffee after we were served our food. Was so frustrated I ended up buying two water bottles to drink while we ate. The place is really small hard to find a table I must say. Very disorganized staff. If you decide to come here go for just coffee nothing complicated or else be prepared to wait a while to get everything you ordered. Overall I will not be coming back here. DO NOT RECOMMEND IT.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

2chzUaume0KPR4g99q5LzQ.text: Oddly, in the week we while here in London, this was the only place serving classic British food that I ventured into.  The place has its charm no doubt and the people are quite nice.  Coffee is surprisingly good, but i can't say that the classic English breakfast hit the mark for me.  There was plenty of food and you wouldn't need to each lunch afterwards, but i'd say it was average at best.

ndlRLim5QSt7OgLgomN9wA.text: I had their full English breakfast and was unimpressed; £10 with tea being on top of that is a bit much. Plus when it came out, the eggs were room temperature. The next day I had a much better full breakfast up the road for half the price with a cappuccino.

w707Hv1NyRtBykqtxVIQlA.text: Until 12n each day if you buy coffee or tea you get a free (and good!) croissant.  A large cappuccino will run you 2.80 along with the free croissant.  I don't know where you'd find a better deal than that.  There's free wifi too.  I'd probably be here daily to start my day if I lived in the area.

qScm6JnspnlNpxxr_XNVOQ.text: This place was close to our hotel and had great reviews so we decided to give it a try.  The coffee was great and we all received free croissants.  We ordered an English breakfast which was also delicious.  The atmosphere was also conducive for relaxing a bit, with indoor and outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom

6FgGPTQ03_zGQWpGAf-Pmw.text: Good cheap eats! I had the veggie breakfast and it was a lot of food. Tomato, mushrooms ( so good), fried eggs, baked beans, and toast. It also comes with orange juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Veggie English Breakfast, good cheap eats!

UV6nAmB4J2KrzCSh7MZqdA.text: Excellent Full English Breakfast!We had an English breakfast at our hotel yesterday that was terrible. Today we tried Caffe Forum and the breakfast was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Caffe Forum - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast  We added coffee, a croissant and a muffin.

hjUQWDSkZPWcqz5BDfO32w.text: I'm in London several times a month for work and this is my go to breakfast spot. The latte's and fresh squeezed OJ with their (often free) croissants are delicious, and the sausage and eggs are my favorite usual order.Everyone is so nice in here and all the food on display for lunch looks amazing too.

HbXzBLQmwO7zhgKAxFSZQQ.text: Thank goodness for this place! We had gotten out of a show at Royal Albert Hall kind of late, and were starving. Our timing was pretty bad at that point - everything was either closed, or closing up as we spotted them. I thought we were going to have to eat at the Burger King (blech) when we noticed this one little spot.Entering, the place was pretty packed with a large group of men playing chess - there were at least half a dozen boards set up around the dining room. We walked up to the counter to see what was on offer, and the friendly gentleman at the register told us that at that time of night, what we saw was what he had to offer.I was hungry enough to eat my feet, and was half a step away from drooling over the case. He asked, "How hungry are you?" and I, unthinking, replied, "STARVING!"I pointed out what I wanted - Chinese noodles and some of the ribs (don't judge me!), while the hubs chose a roll and some pasta salad. I then stood in awe as the gentleman began heaping food onto my plate. I do not kid when I say he heaped. By the time he was done, there was enough food to feed three people (or, you know - me when I'm hungry). He told us to take a seat, and he'd bring the plates out to us.We did, and he did - he had warmed the food back up for us, so that it was piping hot. Not only that, he came back to the table with a bowl of water for my hands, since I was tearing in to the portion of ribs and getting sauce all over the place.The food was good, too. I'm not ashamed to admit that I ate most of what he gave me - either from obligation or because my middle name is "Oink". No, it was because the food was good and sustaining. We were both stuffed by the time we put our forks down, and it was a nice feeling - we were warm, we were full and the food had been delicious. Plus, I'm giving huge points to the friendly gentleman behind the counter (he may have been the owner).On a different note, we were walking back to the hotel the following day, and I noticed a car door open in front of us. I happened to glance in, and noticed it was the gentleman from the night before, and he recognized us! We definitely would go back, if we're in the area again.
